column4: I'm running Lucid, and I can't get my microphone to be detected.  Halp?
microphones and webcams are kind of an issue with Linux, is it a machine microphone?
you can lspci to see if it shows up and then try to find a driver for it.
Is this it? "Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801I (ICH9 Family) HD Audio Controller (rev 03)"
No, that looks like one of your sound controllers.
Well, if that's not it, I don't think I see anything.
One moment,
http://paste.ubuntu.com/ - post the output of your lspci there.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/454108/
I do not see it either. = / Unfortunately I have the same issue.
Then what is to be done?
Go buy a nice usb driven microphone or microphone/headset setup and enjoy it? I've never really succeeded in getting my microphone working.
In general, yes sir. I would not buy anything from Microsoft, like their wireless headset. I would get a logitech product. Ideally it should work out-of-the-box.
And should it detect a microphone that I plug into the microphone jack on the computer?
Again that's up in the air. It depends on whether or not your Linux will detect your phone jack. Does it detect your headset jack when you plugin headsets?
And my sound pretty much just stopped working.
On your speakers?
Wait, now it is.
So is it not going to be able to detect microphones that I plug into the microphone jack?
It should, but I'd play it safe and get a USB microphone. That will almost certainly work.
You can try it. Plug them in - if they're not detected, reboot while they're plugged in.
We've got it working.  We just need a cable to merge the headphone and microphone cable into one.
Thanks for your help.
Always a pleasure.
